## Natural history notes

The floating antler-fern (Ceratopteris pteridoides) is a native, floating plant found in freshwater wetlands. This species typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, so its range in the United States is limited to Florida and parts of southern Louisiana and Georgia. This plant has a wide range of sizes, but in the right conditions, it can grow up to four feet long!
